item.title: Nubelia add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "The trouble with having an open mind, of course, is that people will insist on coming along and trying to put things in it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Nubelia add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Give a man a fire and he's warm for a day, but set fire to him and he's warm for the rest of his life." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Nubelia add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "I'll be more enthusiastic about encouraging thinking outside the box when there's evidence of any thinking going on inside it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Nubelia add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Real stupidity beats artificial intelligence every time." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Nubelia add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description:
"Most of the members of the convent were old-fashioned Satanists, like their parents and grandparents before them. They'd been brought up to it, and weren't, when you got right down to it, particularly evil. Human beings mostly aren't. They just get carried away by new ideas, like dressing up in jackboots and shooting people, or dressing up in white sheets and lynching people, or dressing up in tie-dye jeans and playing guitars at people. Offer people a new creed with a costume and their hearts and minds will follow. Anyway, being brought up as a Satanist tended to take the edge off it. It was something you did on Saturday nights.
And the rest of the time you simply got on with life as best you could, just like everyone else." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Nubelia add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Chaos is found in greatest abundance wherever order is being sought. It always defeats order, because it is better organized." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Nubelia add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "She'd become a governess. It was one of the few jobs a known lady could do. And she'd taken to it well. She'd sworn that if she did indeed ever find herself dancing on rooftops with chimney sweeps she'd beat herself to death with her own umbrella." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Nubelia add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "In ancient times cats were worshipped as gods; they have not forgotten this." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Nubelia add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "His philosophy was a mixture of three famous schools -- the Cynics, the Stoics and the Epicureans -- and summed up all three of them in his famous phrase, 'You can't trust any bugger further than you can throw him, and there's nothing you can do about it, so let's have a drink." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Nubelia add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "He was currently wondering vaguely who Moey and Chandon were." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Nubelia add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Nubelia add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Nubelia add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Those who find ugly meanings in beautiful things are corrupt without being charming. This is a fault. Those who find beautiful meanings in beautiful things are the cultivated. For these there is hope. They are the elect to whom beautiful things mean only Beauty. There is no such thing as a moral or an immoral book. Books are well written, or badly written. That is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Nubelia add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The truth is rarely pure and never simple." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Nubelia add a quote by Stephen Fry
item.description: "It is a cliche that most cliches are true, but then like most cliches, that cliche is untrue." -- Stephen Fry

item.title: Nubelia add a quote by Stephen Fry
item.description: "An original idea. That can't be too hard. The library must be full of them." -- Stephen Fry

item.title: Nubelia add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "The liar's punishment is, not in the least that he is not believed, but that he cannot believe anyone else." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Nubelia add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Why should we take advice on sex from the pope? If he knows anything about it, he shouldn't!" -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Nubelia add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "First we thought the PC was a calculator. Then we found out how to turn numbers into letters with ASCII — and we thought it was a typewriter. Then we discovered graphics, and we thought it was a television. With the World Wide Web, we've realized it's a brochure." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Nubelia add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The fact that we live at the bottom of a deep gravity well, on the surface of a gas covered planet going around a nuclear fireball 90 million miles away and think this to be normal is obviously some indication of how skewed our perspective tends to be." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Nubelia add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "A common mistake that people make when trying to design something completely foolproof is to underestimate the ingenuity of complete fools." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Nubelia add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "If I ever meet myself,' said Zaphod, 'I'll hit myself so hard I won't know what's hit me." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Nubelia add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "That young girl is one of the least benightedly unintelligent organic life forms it has been my profound lack of pleasure not to be able to avoid meeting." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Nubelia add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "He hoped and prayed that there wasn't an afterlife. Then he realized there was a contradiction involved here and merely hoped that there wasn't an afterlife." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Nubelia add a quote by Tagore
item.description: "The water in a vessel is sparkling; the water in the sea is dark. The small truth has words which are clear; the great truth has great silence." -- Tagore

item.title: Nubelia add a quote by Rabindranath Tagore
item.description: "A mind all logic is like a knife all blade. It makes the hand bleed that uses it." -- Rabindranath Tagore

item.title: Nubelia add a quote by a very happy rodent
item.description: "free at last from the leaking vessel " -- a very happy rodent

item.title: Nubelia add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "Red hair, sir, in my opinion, is dangerous." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: Nubelia add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "The voice of Love seemed to call to me, but it was a wrong number." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: Nubelia add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "She looked as if she had been poured into her clothes and had forgotten to say "when". " -- P.G. Wodehouse
